com.apriori.apt.testing

Class CompilationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.apt.testing.CompilationContext

  • public class CompilationContext
extends Object
    The context for invoking a compiler and running annotation processors. To run a task in the annotation phase of a compilation, create a new context, create a task in that context, and then run the task. Example: 
     CompilationContext context = new CompilationContext();
 // seed input files using context.getFileManager()
 context.newTask().processingFiles(listOfFiles).run(myProcessingTask);

    • Nested Class Summary

      Builds a task to run in this compilation context.
      static interface  CompilationContext.TaskBuilderWithProcessor
      Builds a task to run in this compilation context.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JavaCompiler getCompiler()
      Returns the system compiler that will be invoked when tasks are run in this context.
      CategorizingDiagnosticCollector getDiagnosticCollector()
      Returns the diagnostic collector used to collect output from compiler invocations.
      TestJavaFileManager getFileManager()
      Returns the file manager for this compilation context, used to seed input files or examine output files.
      CompilationContext.TaskBuilder newTask()
      Returns a new task builder that can execute a task during the annotation processing phase of the compiler.
